subject: Re: [junit] Can we have multiple runs for a single test method of the Unit test case
msgSnippet: Cedric, What could be value of repeated test alone? In JUnit 3 I m using RepeatedTest together with ActiveTestSuite to perform rudimentary concurrency testing,
messageBody:
Cedric,

What could be value of repeated test alone?

In JUnit 3 I'm using RepeatedTest together with ActiveTestSuite to
perform rudimentary concurrency testing, but that is about it.

regards,
Eugene


Cédric Beust ♔ wrote:

>On 11/22/05, saff@... <saff@...> wrote:
>
>
>>Mohan,
>>
>>Generally, this is tackled using the Parameterized Test Case
>>pattern. It's
>>described well in Rainsberger's book "JUnit Recipes", but here's a recent
>>example from the list (thanks, Elliotte). Share and Enjoy,
>>
>>
>
>
>Here is how TestNG does it (please consider this for inclusion in JUnit 4):
>
>@Test(invocationCount = 5)
>public void testMethod() {
> ...
>}
>
>--
>Cédric
>
>
>
